body: The invitation is sent, notice, this is a new application, so everything is blank for now.

> The invitation is sent, notice, this is a new application, so everything is blank for now.

Looks good, I accepted.

@wu-sheng `Gc Count` metric is also wrong in `otel-oc-rules/oap.yaml` and `fetcher-prom-rules/self.yaml`. I also have fixed it and pull a request. please help me review. Thank you!

Let's take a look at the comparison of the trend chart before and after the modification.

Before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29882506/159211273-f2cdd4a0-4bb2-4cab-b393-0a4e936fb8ed.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29882506/159211290-b8c499f5-4900-4d51-a3bc-f8919189a909.png)

After:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29882506/159211375-b004760e-8736-4529-b378-739f89443100.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29882506/159211389-7a22cfcc-7ce3-4aa0-88c8-22b6d72c1f91.png)

In general, before the modification, the value of the metric will become larger and larger over time. The value per minute exceeds the normal value

This looks good, just please rename `first aggregation` -> `L1 aggregation` and `second` -> `L2`. 

Also, make sure change logs includes both fixes in your pull request.

Some examples

<details>
  <summary>Submit a task to generate segments</summary>

  ```shell

### Submit a task to generate mock segment data, 100 segments per seconds

POST http://localhost:12800/mock-data/segments/tasks?qps=100
Content-Type: application/json

{
    "traceId": {
        "type": "randomString",
        "length": "20",
        "letters": true,
        "numbers": true
    },
    "serviceInstanceId": {
        "type": "randomString",
        "length": "10",
        "letters": true,
        "numbers": true
    },
    "dataBinary": {
        "type": "randomString",
        "length": "10",
        "prefix": "test",
        "letters": true,
        "numbers": true
    },
    "segmentId": {
        "type": "randomString",
        "length": "20",
        "letters": true,
        "numbers": true
    },
    "serviceId": {
        "type": "randomString",
        "length": "10",
        "letters": true,
        "numbers": true
    },
    "endpointId": {
        "type": "randomString",
        "length": "10",
        "prefix": "test_",
        "letters": true,
        "numbers": true,
        "domainSize": 10 // at most 10 different `endpointId`s will be generated in this task
    },
    "startTime": {
        "type": "randomInt",
        "min": "1647868381000",
        "max": "1647878402000"
    },
    "latency": {
        "type": "randomInt",
        "min": 100,
        "max": 1000
    },
    "error": {
        "type": "randomInt",
        "min": "0",
        "max": "1"
    },
    "tags": {
        "type": "randomList",
        "size": 5,
        "item": {
            "key": {
                "type": "randomString",
                "length": "10",
                "prefix": "test",
                "letters": true,
                "numbers": true,
                "domainSize": 10 // At most 10 different tag key will generated in this task
            },
            "value": {
                "type": "randomString",
                "length": "10",
                "prefix": "test",
                "letters": true,
                "numbers": true
            }
        }
    }
}
  ```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>Cancel the segment generating task</summary>

  ```shell
### Cancel the task, with the requestId return from the previous request
DELETE http://localhost:12800/mock-data/segments/tasks?requestId=8bbdaee6-2193-405d-bc0c-a650cd17597e

  ```

</details>

<details>
  <summary>List all segment tasks</summary>

  ```shell
### List all tasks that are now running
GET http://localhost:12800/mock-data/segments/tasks
  ```

</details>
In this PR I only implement the data generators for Segment and Log, not metrics.
@hanahmily @lujiajing1126 please check whether ^^^ that will be sufficient for our BanyanDB MVP tests.

Questions
1. Is the ID generated as a random string only? If so, we may face errors in queries as they are not well encoded. How about generating names?
2. Let's add `UUID` and `Java-Trace-ID` generator for trace ID generating, which could make the ID more reasonable.
3. I can see `domainSize` in endpoint and tags, should we add(or added) for service and instance too?
4. `error` should have a error stack attachment, which should be generated inside span's logs.
5. The number of spans(with tags and logs) seems missing.
6. Recommend to write a README.md for this testing-mode tar, including how to use, and examples of traces generated.

> In this PR I only implement the data generators for Segment and Log

Could you make the log command clear?
@wu-sheng do we need the mock data to be that real and do we need to query the data through OAP? I even wanted to remove the query module from the new starter...
Support query is necessary. Because one reason to build this is to verify the query performance in large scale of data.
We don't need to make all UI functional working. But GrapgQL should at least be able to work.(considering a lot of logic about data consistent setups in UI and CLI.

Trace ID has been discussed in many places. We don't need to start a new one.

And there is no title.

Similar Question like Wu Sheng's 5th one:

Is it possible for us to specify how many spans will share the same `trace_id` since this is specially treated as a global index in BanyanDB.

> Is it possible for us to specify how many spans will share the same trace_id since this is specially treated as a global index in BanyanDB.

I think for BanyanDB, we care more about how many segments.

> > Is it possible for us to specify how many spans will share the same trace_id since this is specially treated as a global index in BanyanDB.
> 
> I think for BanyanDB, we care more about how many segments.

Oh, right, a typo. I meant `Segment` since all `Span`s are encoded as binary.
My skywalking-java version is 8.1

You should print the full stack, but AFAIK, this is SOFA framework unexpected SkyWalking could add a new interface they are not aware of. Dubbo used to have similar issues, mostly, this should be fixed at SOFA side.

And you should know, according to doc, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-java/v8.9.0/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/supported-list/, we have only tested SOFA RPC v5.4, which is years ago.
Is there any ways to exclude skywalking code weave for some artifact, such as sofa-ark jar.
You are not following. We don't instrument any classes in sofa-ark. This is Sofa ARK can't handle other classes out of sofa-ark.

I found you've also issued a ticket there https://github.com/alibaba/arthas/issues/2120

Does the same solution work this time?

We are just accessing through JDK XBean. 
This looks like a JVM internal error. Not sure what we can do.
I solved the problem of increasing memory ago in arthas ,but this The remaining memory is 200M, still report errorI'll try updating a JDK version and observe
how to fix it?

`.muse` is added in https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/.licenserc.yaml to ignore license header check.

If `.lift`'s files can't have headers(from tech perspective) too, please update `.licenserc.yaml ` file accordingly.

Hi, another thing I noticed is this https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/doddi/skywalking/01FYY8BBCACQ1W0HNQ9HWDBNWS?t=ErrorProne%7CMissingSummary

`MissingSummary` covers the generated codes, which are not controlled by us, they are from `protoc` tool. Is there any way to exclude those too?

https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/doddi/skywalking/01FYY8BBCACQ1W0HNQ9HWDBNWS?t=ErrorProne%7CSameNameButDifferent

Another question is, this is a common use of `@Slf4j`, why is this showing up?

https://github.com/doddi/skywalking/blob/2a1e480d18605d89b62e12e1a020241133ad5dfa/apm-webapp/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/oap/server/webapp/GlobalErrorWebExceptionHandler.java#L34

CI covers this UT in every PR, we never saw it fails.

Are you finding a way to fix it? You clicked `I am willing to submit a PR!`

> Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.
> 
> * Why do you submit this issue?
> * [ ]  Question or discussion
> * [] Bug
> * [ ]  Requirement
> * [ ]  Feature or performance improvement
> 
> ### Bug
> * Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?
>   6.6.0, Linux, Binary Distribution for ElasticSearch 7
> * What happen?
>   After running SkyWalking for three days, SkyWalking Web Page shows no data. Response infos of the WebPage is 'We're sorry but SkyWalking doesn't work properly without JavaScript enabled. Please enable it to continue'. I ensure javascript of myweb view is enabled.

it is because of your wrong SW_OAP_ADDRESS when you setup the oap-ui, don't use 127.0.0.1 or localhost, pls fix it and try again~

> > Please answer these questions before submitting your issue.
> 
> > 
> 
> > * Why do you submit this issue?
> 
> > * [ ]  Question or discussion
> 
> > * [] Bug
>

>

> 
> >

> > ### Bug
> 
> > * Which version of SkyWalking, OS and JRE?
> 
> >   6.6.0, Linux, Binary Distribution for ElasticSearch 7
> 
> > * What happen?
> 
> >   After running SkyWalking for three days, SkyWalking Web Page shows no data. Response infos of the WebPage is 'We're sorry but SkyWalking doesn't work properly without JavaScript enabled. Please enable it to continue'. I ensure javascript of myweb view is enabled.
> 
> 
> 
> it is because of your wrong SW_OAP_ADDRESS when you setup the oap-ui, don't use 127.0.0.1 or localhost, pls fix it and try again~

Please open a discussions thread and post a Q&A style post there. It will be easier for search for others with the same issue. I will mark your answer as accepted. :)

in the Dockerfile, requests is no longer a default setup dependency since end of 2020...

* Remove `isNotNormal` service requirement when use alias to merge service topology from client side.

The above bug exists for nearly a year, when we add `isNormal` in v8, we should not add this condition. Peer alias should always be used for building topology from client-side relationship.
Conclusion, this is not a bug, just **Remove unnecessary InterruptedException catch**

Hello, according to the latest doc (which wasn't updated to reflect the active gRPC channel support in 2018), I think this can be implemented now.

https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/fork_support.md#111

@jlstephens89 Yes, that is gone.

And I found [**subprocess_without_shell_equals_true**, 76 hits](https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/doddi/skywalking/01FZ0G8NAZ7J3WPN59JXRZQ0HK?t=Bandit%7Csubprocess_without_shell_equals_true) and **assert_used**(200+ hits) are just reviewing codes from submodule(UI) part, which should not be reported in this repo. And the error is from `skywalking-ui/node_modules/`, which are the dependencies, not the codes written by SkyWalking UI side. Could you set rules to skip `/skywalking-ui` folder?

The [NonAtomicVolatileUpdate](https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/doddi/skywalking/01FZ0G8NAZ7J3WPN59JXRZQ0HK?t=ErrorProne%7CNonAtomicVolatileUpdate) is false warning, I think. We have added `@SuppressWarnings("NonAtomicVolatileUpdate")` to the field.

[JSC_PARSE_ERROR](https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/doddi/skywalking/01FZ0G8NAZ7J3WPN59JXRZQ0HK?t=Closure-Compiler%7CJSC_PARSE_ERROR) is reporting errors of 3rd party license files. I think we either should skip files not `.java` or expected source files, or at least exclude `/dist-material/release-docs`

[EqualsGetClass](https://lift.sonatype.com/results/github.com/doddi/skywalking/01FZ0G8NAZ7J3WPN59JXRZQ0HK?t=ErrorProne%7CEqualsGetClass) has listed some warnings according to the book <[Effective Java 3rd Edition 10](https://books.google.com/books?id=BIpDDwAAQBAJ)> or other practice you preferred.
But, personally, I don't feel this is an issue, and also, this code style is from IntelliJ's code generator.

Is there a way we don't have to add `@SuppressWarnings("EqualsGetClass")`? Because it seems pointless, this should be a very developer's personal style. Sub-instance should or should not be treated as equal, is debatable.

I place `license-eye` hooks as the below, it works well.

```yaml
- repo: local
  hooks:
    - id: license-header-check
      name: license header check
      entry: license-eye header check
      language: system
      types: [file]
    - id: license-header-fix
      name: license header fix
      entry: license-eye header fix
      language: system
      types: [file]
```
Should we close this?
If there's no need integrating `.pre-commit-config.yaml` into `skywalking-eyes` repo, close it.
I think we don't need to do that. pre-commmit hook is very personal preference, we don't want to set a bar for it.
Are you going to follow this? If not, I am going to close PR.

@dmsolr Please help to verify the `multiGet` in the InfluxDB plugin. 
If we only have the ID and want to use `multiGet` for query traffic, we could degradation to only using field(ID field) without tag(serviceId field).
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/8761 is going to be merged, please check its changes and new uses of `MultiGet`.

The first entry is not evaluated at all, the entire index or additional index can be removed/ added still passing test, but a mixed order list of actual data will lead to error.

Put the following at top of contains will make sure the true first entry should be checked.
```
- e2eplaceholder: workaround-placeholder-for-e2e
    placeholder: ISHOULDNOTEXIST
```
Tracing and Logging e2e coverage is implemented and merged. Closing this issue, note to myself, profiling is not covered yet.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/6.x/docs/en/setup/backend/trace-sampling.md

apache-skywalking-apm-incubating-bin/config/application.yml

```
# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
# distributed with this work for additional information
# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.

cluster:
  standalone:
  # Please check your ZooKeeper is 3.5+, However, it is also compatible with ZooKeeper 3.4.x. Replace the ZooKeeper 3.5+
  # library the oap-libs folder with your ZooKeeper 3.4.x library.
#  zookeeper:
#    nameSpace: ${SW_NAMESPACE:""}
#    hostPort: ${SW_CLUSTER_ZK_HOST_PORT:localhost:2181}
#    #Retry Policy
#    baseSleepTimeMs: ${SW_CLUSTER_ZK_SLEEP_TIME:1000} # initial amount of time to wait between retries
#    maxRetries: ${SW_CLUSTER_ZK_MAX_RETRIES:3} # max number of times to retry
#  kubernetes:
#    watchTimeoutSeconds: ${SW_CLUSTER_K8S_WATCH_TIMEOUT:60}
#    namespace: ${SW_CLUSTER_K8S_NAMESPACE:default}
#    labelSelector: ${SW_CLUSTER_K8S_LABEL:app=collector,release=skywalking}
#    uidEnvName: ${SW_CLUSTER_K8S_UID:SKYWALKING_COLLECTOR_UID}
#  consul:
#    serviceName: ${SW_SERVICE_NAME:"SkyWalking_OAP_Cluster"}
#     Consul cluster nodes, example: 10.0.0.1:8500,10.0.0.2:8500,10.0.0.3:8500
#    hostPort: ${SW_CLUSTER_CONSUL_HOST_PORT:localhost:8500}
core:
  default:
    # Mixed: Receive agent data, Level 1 aggregate, Level 2 aggregate
    # Receiver: Receive agent data, Level 1 aggregate
    # Aggregator: Level 2 aggregate
    role: ${SW_CORE_ROLE:Mixed} # Mixed/Receiver/Aggregator
    restHost: ${SW_CORE_REST_HOST:0.0.0.0}
    restPort: ${SW_CORE_REST_PORT:12800}
    restContextPath: ${SW_CORE_REST_CONTEXT_PATH:/}
    gRPCHost: ${SW_CORE_GRPC_HOST:0.0.0.0}
    gRPCPort: ${SW_CORE_GRPC_PORT:11800}
    downsampling:
    - Hour
    - Day
    - Month
    # Set a timeout on metric data. After the timeout has expired, the metric data will automatically be deleted.
    recordDataTTL: ${SW_CORE_RECORD_DATA_TTL:90} # Unit is minute
    minuteMetricsDataTTL: ${SW_CORE_MINUTE_METRIC_DATA_TTL:90} # Unit is minute
    hourMetricsDataTTL: ${SW_CORE_HOUR_METRIC_DATA_TTL:36} # Unit is hour
    dayMetricsDataTTL: ${SW_CORE_DAY_METRIC_DATA_TTL:45} # Unit is day
    monthMetricsDataTTL: ${SW_CORE_MONTH_METRIC_DATA_TTL:18} # Unit is month
storage:
  h2:
    driver: ${SW_STORAGE_H2_DRIVER:org.h2.jdbcx.JdbcDataSource}
    url: ${SW_STORAGE_H2_URL:jdbc:h2:mem:skywalking-oap-db}
    user: ${SW_STORAGE_H2_USER:sa}
#  elasticsearch:
#    # nameSpace: ${SW_NAMESPACE:""}
#    clusterNodes: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_CLUSTER_NODES:localhost:9200}
#    indexShardsNumber: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_INDEX_SHARDS_NUMBER:2}
#    indexReplicasNumber: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_INDEX_REPLICAS_NUMBER:0}
#    # Batch process setting, refer to https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/java-api/5.5/java-docs-bulk-processor.html
#    bulkActions: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_BULK_ACTIONS:2000} # Execute the bulk every 2000 requests
#    bulkSize: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_BULK_SIZE:20} # flush the bulk every 20mb
#    flushInterval: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_FLUSH_INTERVAL:10} # flush the bulk every 10 seconds whatever the number of requests
#    concurrentRequests: ${SW_STORAGE_ES_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS:2} # the number of concurrent requests
#  mysql:
receiver-sharing-server:
  default:
receiver-register:
  default:
receiver-trace:
  default:
    bufferPath: ${SW_RECEIVER_BUFFER_PATH:../trace-buffer/}  # Path to trace buffer files, suggest to use absolute path
    bufferOffsetMaxFileSize: ${SW_RECEIVER_BUFFER_OFFSET_MAX_FILE_SIZE:100} # Unit is MB
    bufferDataMaxFileSize: ${SW_RECEIVER_BUFFER_DATA_MAX_FILE_SIZE:500} # Unit is MB
    bufferFileCleanWhenRestart: ${SW_RECEIVER_BUFFER_FILE_CLEAN_WHEN_RESTART:false}
    sampleRate: ${SW_TRACE_SAMPLE_RATE:5000} # The sample rate precision is 1/10000. 10000 means 100% sample in default.
    slowDBAccessThreshold: ${SW_SLOW_DB_THRESHOLD:default:200,mongodb:100} # The slow database access thresholds. Unit ms.
receiver-jvm:
  default:
service-mesh:
  default:
    bufferPath: ${SW_SERVICE_MESH_BUFFER_PATH:../mesh-buffer/}  # Path to trace buffer files, suggest to use absolute path
    bufferOffsetMaxFileSize: ${SW_SERVICE_MESH_OFFSET_MAX_FILE_SIZE:100} # Unit is MB
    bufferDataMaxFileSize: ${SW_SERVICE_MESH_BUFFER_DATA_MAX_FILE_SIZE:500} # Unit is MB
    bufferFileCleanWhenRestart: ${SW_SERVICE_MESH_BUFFER_FILE_CLEAN_WHEN_RESTART:false}
istio-telemetry:
  default:
envoy-metric:
  default:
#receiver_zipkin:
#  default:
#    host: ${SW_RECEIVER_ZIPKIN_HOST:0.0.0.0}
#    port: ${SW_RECEIVER_ZIPKIN_PORT:9411}
#    contextPath: ${SW_RECEIVER_ZIPKIN_CONTEXT_PATH:/}
query:
  graphql:
    path: ${SW_QUERY_GRAPHQL_PATH:/graphql}
alarm:
  default:
telemetry:
  none:
```
